concepts.title: Square Roots
concepts.content: The square root of a number n is a number whose square gives n. Every positive number has two square roots (positive and negative). Square root by prime factors: factorise into primes, make pairs, take one from each pair and multiply.

longAnswers.question: State the product rule of indices and verify using 2^3 Ã— 2^4.
longAnswers.modelAnswer: Product rule: a^m Ã— a^n = a^(m+n). Here 2^3Ã—2^4 = 2^(3+4)=2^7=128. Also, 2^3=8 and 2^4=16, so 8Ã—16=128. Verified.
keyPoints: Same base: add exponents.
Rule: a^mÃ—a^n=a^(m+n).
Common mistake: multiplying exponents (3Ã—4) instead of adding.
